snippet.title: Nine things to do around the Illawarra this weekend
snippet.content:
Thursday August 3
Ex-'Blue Heelers' John Wood and Julie Nihill and plays at IPAC through to Saturday. Picture: Jodie Hutchinson
Bakersfield Mist Blue Heelers duo John Wood and Julie Nihill have come together again, this time on stage as Lionel and Maude in Bakersfield Mist. Maude (who lives in a trailer park) believes a painting she picked up at an op shop is a Jackson Pollock worth millions. Lionel is the New York art critic sent to authenticate it. Running at the Illawarra Performing Arts Centre until Saturday. For ticket details visit:
Friday August 4
Paterson - Trailer Gerringong Pics and Flicks
Presenting the comedy drama Paterson at Gerringong Town Hall. 7:20pm with film starting at 8pm Paterson is a hardworking bus driver in New Jersey who follows the same routine every day. Starring Adam Driver, Golshifteh Farahani and Helen-Jean Arthur. Saturday August 5
Ryback battles two athletes at the same time 2-on-1: SmackDown Former WWE Superstar at the Snakepit Former World Wrestling Entertainment superstar Ryback is bringing his hard-hitting style to the Illawarra. The man-mountain will appear at Rock 'n' Roll Wrestling's professional show at Wollongong Snake Pit (Beaton Park) Saturday night. The will headline the 'Feed Me More Tour', named after the ex-WWE fan favourite's popular catchphrase. Doors open 6:30pm, Show 7:00pm
For more information:
A Tale of Love and Darkness - Trailer Israeli Film Festival A Tale of Love and Darkness: the adaptation of Amos Oz's autobiographical novel. Stars Natalie Portman, Shira Haas and Tomer Kapon. Directed by Natalie Portman. Wedding Doll: Stars Moran Rosenblatt, Roy Assaf and Assi Levy. Directed by Nitzan Gilady. All proceeds go to helping local girl Chloe Saxby who suffers from the rare Vanishing White Matter Disease. A supper of traditional foods like hummus, mini challah rolls, kugels and cheesecakes will also be on offer.
Saturday, 7pm, at the UOW McKinnon Building (67). Best parking is P3. For ticket information
Tomcat Playground are one of the acts performing for International Blues Day on Saturday. Picture: Supplied International Blues Day Celebrate International Blues Day with free back-to- back blues at the Kiama Leagues Club from 1pm to midnight. Pete Cornelius and the Devilles, Continental Robert Susz Blues Party, Simon Kinny-Lewis, Tomcat Playground, Mya Szwec's Groove Depot with Pat Powell and 500 Pounds of Joy. More FREE music on Sunday in Kiama's Hindmarsh Park with Jack Rose, Mark Dabin and the Simon Dyos Band from 1:15pm to 3:30pm.
For more information visit:
Picture: Adam McLean Downhill Mountain Biking RedAss Downhill Enduro Series Round One runs across Saturday and Sunday at Green Valleys Freeride Park in Tongarra - 8am to 5pm.
Organisers from Rocky Trail Entertainment are expecting more than racers from all over NSW and the ACT to participate in this event.
Racers will be able to sign up online ahead of the race.
Spectator entry is free.
Bulerias improvisadas Flamenco Dancing
When virtuoso guitarist Damian Wright meets award-winning dancer Jessica Statham, the result is Bandaluzia Flamenco - the dazzling Flamenco act that will have you in raptures.
Bandaluzia is highly acclaimed for its ability to mix elements of other genres into their performances - the rich harmonies of jazz, the exotic melodies of the Orient and the infectious rhythms of South America.
The Music Lounge at Wollongong Town Hall. Tickets $40. Doors and bar open 7:30pm. Recommended for ages 12+ For more information visit Sunday August 6
Thirroul double bass player Adrian Whitehall is excited to finally perform in front of a home crowd with the Sydney Youth Orchestra on Sunday. Picture: Adam Mclean Sydney Youth Orchestra with special guest Naoko Keatley of the London Symphony Orchestra. Ambitious in structure but not as popular as the Ninth Symphony "From the New World", many critics consider the 7th Symphony to be the composer's greatest and an important example of the development of the symphonic genre post-Beethoven.
Inspired by Brahms' 3rd Symphony, Dvorak's seventh great orchestral work was fortuitously supported by a commission from the Philharmonic Society of London.
Wollongong Town Hall, main auditorium, 3pm. Adults $25, children and concession $18.
For more information:
Live music and market stalls at The Farm's Market this Sunday. Picture: Sylvia Liber The Farm's Market The Farms Market is located in one of the most picturesque spots on the South Coast, Killalea State Park at Shell Cove - 10am to 3pm. With over 90 stalls stocked with the latest fashions, a huge range of local producers, sweets, brewers, artisans, florists and food...plus everything else in between! Bring the family and make a day of it - with plenty of grass for the kids to play all that's left to do is sit back, relax and enjoy the live music and spectacular views. Please leave your fur-babies at home. Domestic animals are not allowed within the park.

sindex.name: RedAss Downhill Enduro Series Round One
